description:
Agmasoma sp. JBojko-2022a is a species of microorganism that belongs to the genus Agmasoma. The genus Agmasoma is a group of unicellular eukaryotic organisms that are classified within the phylum Microsporidia.

Microsporidia are a diverse group of obligate intracellular parasites that infect a wide range of hosts, including invertebrates, vertebrates, and even other microorganisms. These parasites have a unique life cycle that involves the formation of spores, which are the infective stage of the organism.

The specific species Agmasoma sp. JBojko-2022a was recently identified and described by a researcher named JBojko in 2022. The species was likely named using a combination of the genus name Agmasoma and the initials of the researcher who discovered it, followed by the year of the discovery.

Beyond these basic taxonomic details, further information about the characteristics, habitat, or ecological role of this particular species is not readily available without additional research or documentation.
